subject: Psychology
title: Storytelling as Persuasion
description: A 60-second lesson on Storytelling as Persuasion.

hook.text: Data says smoking kills. A mother's story about losing her son to lung cancer changes behavior. Stories move people.

buildup.text: Narratives are more persuasive than statistics because they transport you into another person's experience.

discovery.text: Transportation theory says being 'lost in a story' lowers resistance and changes beliefs without triggering defenses.

twist.text: This is why propaganda uses stories, not spreadsheets. A compelling narrative bypasses critical analysis.

climax.text: Stories are the oldest persuasion technology. They work because humans are wired to learn through narrative.

punchline.text: A good story slips past the guards that block arguments.

quiz.question: Why are stories more persuasive than statistics?
options: They transport the listener and lower resistance to change
Statistics are always more convincing than stories
